reviews.review_msg: Worth taking a course with Dr. Williamson. He will sincerely tell you what to focus on with no BS. If you do bad on any of the midterms and great on the final. He will take your final exam's mark as the overall. Study from lecture notes. Not everything will be tested on. But when he says "this is VERY important" its for a reason he is saying it!

Dr Davidson is a good prof. It's true that he reads out straight from his lecture notes but MBB321 is an introductory course, so there is not much to add to it although he adds lots of medicine, and pharmaceutical related concepts to course content. He tries hard to be funny :D He tells what he wants from you.  I will take more courses with him.

Come to class and ace MT 1 cause he tells you what's important so listen. Study hard and youll do well despite MT 2. I liked his jokes. Very friendly and good additional info. If you NEED the course split into 5 midterms then take with Northwood but Dr Davidson was a great professor anyway despite compounding.

ATTEND CLASS. He will literally point out what will be on the exam, however this is an MBB class and it is 321 so the after the first exam it can be a lot of info to remember. Very nice person and is always there to help. I skipped some classes because lectures are recorded, but try not to miss too many because he'll talk at the end with a mute mic

Overall the class is pretty tough, there is a lot of material to memorize. He does give a lot of helpful hints during lectures as to what he wants you to know. Tests get increasingly more difficult, the final is very tough... I would definitely recommend him though, makes 321 a lot easier to understand compared to other profs who teach the class.

Pretty good prof but 4.3/5 is probably a little generous in my opinion. I agree that this courses might have double the material of a standard MBB course. Dr. Davidson does a great job of providing hints for exams. Review classes were extremely helpful at end of semester, lots of questions on final were taken directly from there. 8:30am slot brutal
HE IS ABSOLUTELY AMAZING, AND HELPFUL, MUST TAKE THIS COURSE WITH HIM!!

The course itself is A LOT of work but it is not impossible to do well.  Two mt's each worth 20% and final can be made to be worth 60, 80 or 100% of your final grade if it works in your favor. I loved the class and did very well. He tells u exactly what to expect on tests and drops a lot of hints.  Its an MBB course, no MBB course is an easy ride

An awesome prof. Was clear about everything that we were going to need to know for the exams. Exams were not easy, but if you took his headsups seriously, there was no reason not to do well. Plus, he made a topic that would have been dry actually quite interesting. If you have to take it, take it with him. You won't regret it.

He was possibly the nicest prof at SFU. His exams were not easy but he did tell us what was expected. A lots of material! If you can't avoid Mbb 321, take it with Dr. Davidson. It will make your life lots easier

Straight forward, tells you exactly what's on the exam, always available for office hour or e-mail questions. The course itself is hard but he makes it digestible. Midterms coast you in, final was brutal. Keep up with this course!

He started off telling us exactly what was going to be on the first midterm, which was great. Then, the second midterm hits, with an average of 47%. The final was even more difficult, as he expected us to know little things he covered in passing. If you did well on the first midterm, you were set.
organic chem final was a piece of cake compared to his final, you basically have to know everything.

Final was BRUTAL, the course was already overwhelming and he expects so much detail from u! True that he does tell u whats "on" the exam but he adds on additional questions that will drive u crazy. So make sure u do good on first MT as his exams get more difficult and much longer. He is BIG on enzyme fates, there was A LOT of them in the final.
Awsome prof, by far one of the best I have ever had. he tells you exactly what will be on his exam. He makes a challenging course very easy and interesting..

If you are good at memorizing reaction pathways, charts, graphs and other stuff this is the class for you and you will like his exams. Oh and the powerpoint notes are really really good if you want to dig into the material.
The best prof I've had at SFU.  He gives you a real appreciation and understanding of metabolism

The material is overwhelming, but he really points out the take-home message. He literally tells you what will be on the exam. He's a really good prof in that he makes students not only memorize the material, but really understand it inside out. Very helpful, funny, and nice.

The amount for this course is enormous, could double most of the existing courses~ The prof expects a lot from you! He wishes to have a 99% avg while in reality, it stands around 50~60%. He is a professional, but this is why he lacks understanding on students' perspectives

AWESOME GUY. hes one of those profs that is actually there for the students and will go out of his way to help you (hilarious too) a rare good prof! kinda reminds me of sean connery. His exams are challenging but fair just A LOT OF WRITING! i highly recomened Willie!

Funny guy.  Tells what will be on exams, but don't rely only on that b/c sometimes stuff he said wasn't on exam/sometimes it was.  Midterms and final had mostly fair questions (with exception of a few), but very long (use time wisely)...non-stop writing, little thinking time.
he tells u what he wants u to know for the exam.."no surprises"...a lot of memorization..though he makes one of the hardcore mbb courses not as tough
His exams were'nt too bad, challenging yet fair.  Don't memorize too much details for this class - just the 'big picture'.
